movies.title: Brasserie Romantique
movies.plot: Forty-something Pascaline runs a restaurant and prepares the stylish dining room for Valentine's Day. How could she expect her lover of twenty years ago to appear and asks her to leave with him to Buenos Aires. Her patrons of the evening also cope with the unexpected. Thirty-something, bored housewife Rose informs her husband that she has a lover. Almost fifty Mia intends to commit suicide when she is courted by waiter Lesley. And inconspicuous civil servant Walter is wrecked by insecurity when seated in front of the woman of his dreams.
movies.simplePlot: Forty-something Pascaline runs a restaurant and prepares the stylish dining room for Valentine's Day. How could she expect her lover of twenty years ago to appear and asks her to leave with...

biography.bio: Filip Peeters was born on December 2, 1962 in Anderlecht, Belgium. Filip has been working in the theatre since 1987, but his roles in film and television have really brought him into the spotlight. Being fluent in German, he has been expanding his career in Germany since 2000, where his popularity rivals that in his native Belgium. Moreover, he has also appeared in several English and French speaking productions, thus establishing Filip as one of the few Flemish international actors. He is known for his work on Tangiers (2006), Die Frau vom Checkpoint Charlie (2006), Loft (2008) and Salamander (2011).
biography.name: Filip Peeters

biography.bio: Barbara Sarafian was born on april 16, 1968 in Ghent, Belgium. Her father was half Armenian and a painter. Her mother was a painter and teacher at the school of fine-arts in Ghent. She was raised bilingual French and Flemish/Dutch. She studied at the Academy of Dramatic Arts in Antwerp and at Paralax in Brussels. At first she was known as "Sonja Duplex" her alter-ego in the radio show "De Lieve Lust" on 'Studio Brussel'. Her first appearance in a feature film was in the short film "Pasta!" Very short after that she started an international career in "CQ" by Roman Coppola and "Fortress II" by Geoff Murphy. In 1999 she starred her first big role in Peter Greenaway's "8 ½ woman" as Clothilde. She takes a few years sabbatical to raise her son. In 2008, Sarafian starred in Christophe Van Rompaey's "Moscow Belgium" as a ...mother of 3, surviving the mid-life crisis of her husband an falling in love with Johnny, a much younger truck-driver. Her powerful performance in the...role won awards at numeric festivals. She gets two times awarded for best actress. In de USA newspapers write about "Barbara Sarafian in an Oscar-caliber performance". In the following years she plays persuasive roles in "De SM rechter", "Sint", "Zot van A" and "Marieke Marieke" wherefore she was nominated as best actress in a supporting role. In 2011 she starred in the role of Eva Forrestier in Michael Roskam's "Bullhead", next to Matthias Schoenaerts. Between 2012 en 2014 she's playing main- and supporting roles in "Allez Eddy", "Emmenez-moi", "Hemel", "Billy the bully" and "Brasserie Romantiek". For her role in "Brasserie Romantiek" she wins the Ensor for Best Supporting Actress. Most recently she has starred in Nic Balthazar's "Everybody Happy" as Laura Mares and as Marianne in Christophe Van Rompaey's "Vincent". For that last part she wins the Boccalino d'Oro 2016 award as best actress. Besides her work on the big screen she has a comprehensive palmares in television series and shows. She plays main roles in i.a. "Dubbelleven", "Vossenstreken" , "Clan (The Out-Laws)" en "In Vlaamse Velden". For her role in "in Vlaamse velden" she wins in 2015 a Tv-star for Best Actress. Her main parts as supporting actress were in "Zone Stad", "Kiekens", "Aspe" en "Professor T". She starred also in sketch and comedy shows as "achter de feiten", "Tegen de sterren op" en "Wat als?". Barbara Sarafian played some acclaimed parts in theatre. Her remarkable performances were in i.a. 'Uniroyal', 'Alles van Eva (All about Eve)' and 'Closer'. Sarafian will be playing in Gilles Coulier's "Cargo", ..."Wij", and tv-series "Beau Séjour", "De Infiltrant" en "De Dag" .
biography.name: Barbara Sarafian

biography.bio: Koen De Bouw was born on September 30, 1964 in Turnhout, Flanders, Belgium. He is an actor, known for The Last Tycoon (2016), Professor T. (2015) and Menace sur la Maison Blanche (2016). He is married to Chantal Leyers. They have two children.
biography.name: Koen De Bouw

biography.bio: Anemone Valcke is an actress, known for Moscow, Belgium (2008), Offline (2012) and Oxygène (2010).
biography.name: Anemone Valcke

biography.bio: Ruth Becquart is an actress, known for Gent West (2018), Sed Leks (2004) and Clan (2012).
biography.name: Ruth Becquart

biography.bio: Wouter Hendrickx is an actor, known for La merditude des choses (2009), Oxygène (2010) and Cordon (2014).

biography.bio: Axel Daeseleire was born on October 26, 1968 in Gent, Belgium. He is an actor, known for Flikken (1999), Urgence disparitions (2008) and The Intruder (2005).
biography.name: Axel Daeseleire

biography.bio: Mathijs Scheepers is known for his work on Urgence disparitions (2008), Kinderen van Dewindt (2005) and W. - Witse de film (2014).

biography.bio: Brit Van Hoof is an actress, known for The Beast (2014), Les Ardennes (2015) and Belgica (2016).
biography.name: Brit Van Hoof

biography.bio: Zoë Thielemans is an actress, known for Robyn O. (14) (2012), Cordon (2014) and Brasserie Romantique (2012).
biography.name: Zoë Thielemans

biography.bio: Tine Embrechts is an actress, known for Tegen de sterren op (2010), Anneliezen (2010) and Labyrinthus (2014). She is married to Roman. They have one child.
biography.name: Tine Embrechts

biography.bio: Stijn Steyaert is an actor, known for Skilz (2011), It's Showtime! (2017) and Brasserie Romantique (2012).
biography.name: Stijn Steyaert

biography.bio: Sara de Roo is an actress, known for Rosie, sa vie est dans sa tête (1998), Loft (2008) and Nowhere Man (2008).
biography.name: Sara de Roo

biography.bio: Thomas Janssens is an actor, known for The Beast (2014), Tunnelrat (2008) and Labyrinthus (2014).
biography.name: Thomas Janssens
